ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was exposed to a wide breadth of topics in neuroscience and clinical areas. Had the opportunity to interact with leaders in the field.
I learned how to coordinate visits in an organized and well-communicated manner, and I improved my skills in interacting professionally with researchers in the field.
Knowledge of the ongoing work being conducted by leading scientists in the field of clinical neuroscience

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Too much focus on Clinical interests. The atmosphere of the brown bag series has too much emphasis on Professors asking questions. More effort could be made to make sure students feel comfortable asking questions and interacting with speakers.
This was a great current works semester!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, provides breadth to the field and exposure to young researchers and innovative ideas.
YES! It was an excellent lineup of speakers.
Yes - anyone interested in current work in clinical psychology or neuroscience!
